event_registry_properties.name: action
event_registry_properties.item: Schedule a repair action to replace the affected Field Replaceable Unit (FRU), the identity of which can be determined using fmdump -v -u EVENT_ID. Please consult the detail section of the knowledge article for additional information.
event_registry_properties.name: description
event_registry_properties.item: An misconfigured FRU or device has been detected during powerup. Please consult the detail section of the knowledge article for additional information.
event_registry_properties.name: details
event_registry_properties.item:
A misconfigured FRU or device has been detected during powerup.

The misconfigured FRU can be identified from the FMRI of the fault event.

The following section provides a list of the potential FRUs and devices that can
be detected as misconfigured during powerup, and specifies the impact and automated
actions taken by the platform or domain in response to the fault.


   SPARC Enterprise M3000 platform:

      DDC on Motherboard Unit (MBU):

         Platform is powered down and will not be powered up.
         Platform becomes unbootable.



   SPARC Enterprise M4000/M5000 platforms:


      DDC on a DDC_A on a Motherboard:
      DDC on a DDC_A on an IOU:
      DDC on a DDC_B on a Motherboard:
      DDC on a DDC_B on a DDC Riser:

         The entire platform will not be powered up.
         The platform becomes unbootable.
 

      DDC on a CPU Module (CPUM):
 
         Powerup request for the CPU Module is rejected.
         CPU Module is deconfigured.



   SPARC Enterprise M8000/M9000 platforms:


      DDC on a DDC_A:

         If there remains an operational DDC_A, then the incorrect DDC_A is deconfigured.
         If there are no DDC_A's operational, then the platform will not power up.


      DDC on a CPU Module (CPUM):

         Powerup request for the CPU Module is rejected.
         CPU Module is deconfigured.


      DDC on a CPU/Memory Unit (CMU):
      SSM on a CMU:
   
         Powerup request for the CMU is rejected.
         CMU is deconfigured, along with all its associated I/O.


      DDC on an IO Unit(IOU):
      SSM on an IOU:         

         Powerup request for the IOU is rejected.
         IOU is deconfigured.


      DDC on a DDC on a Crossbar (XBU):
      SSM on a Crossbar (XBU):

         Powerup request for the XBU is rejected.
         XBU is deconfigured.

            If this is the first crossbar way being deconfigured,
            then the platform will operate with reduced performance.

            If a crossbar way has already been deconfigured,
            then the platform will be powered down.


      DDC on a Clock Unit (CLKU):

         Powerup request for the CLKU is rejected.
         CLKU is deconfigured.

            If there remain sufficient operational DDC's on a Clock Unit,
            then no action is taken and nothing is deconfigured.

            If this is the active Clock Unit and there are insufficient operational
            DDCs on the active Clock Unit, then the active Clock Unit is powered off,
            the platform is reset, and the active Clock Unit is deconfigured.
 
            If this is the standby Clock Unit and there are insufficient operational
            DDCs on the standby Clock Unit, then the standby Clock Unit
            is powered off and no further action is taken.




The recommended service action for this event is to schedule the replacement of the affected FRU.

       LEGEND

      RED        = SUNW-MSG-ID
      BLUE     = EVENT_ID
      GREEN  = FRU


Step 1. Collect the Fault Message  (two methods)


   Single-line fault message displayed on the XSCF console:

   Mar 27 15:26:48 nwk-dc2-1-sc0 fmd: SOURCE: sde, REV: 1.12, CSN: nwk-dc2-1  
   EVENT-ID: 69f0e34e-ecfd-4778-9f68-666e49b4015f
   Refer to http://www.sun.com/msg/ SCF-8004-HY for detailed information.


   Complete fault message using 'fmdump -m' on the XSCF console:
 
   MSG-ID:  SCF-8004-HY, TYPE: Fault, VER: 1, SEVERITY: Critical
   EVENT-TIME: Tue Mar 27 15:26:48 PDT 2007
   PLATFORM: SPARC-Enterprise, CSN: nwk-dc2-1, HOSTNAME: nwk-dc2-1-sc0
   SOURCE: sde, REV: 1.12
   EVENT-ID: 69f0e34e-ecfd-4778-9f68-666e49b4015f
   DESC: An misconfigured FRU or device has been detected during powerup.
   Please consult the detail section of the knowledge article for additional information.
   Refer to http://www.sun.com/msg/SCF-8004-HY for more information.
   AUTO-RESPONSE: The misconfigured FRU or device will not be powered up.
   Please consult the detail section of the knowledge article for additional information.
   IMPACT: The misconfigured FRU or device will not be powered up. The platform may not powerup.
   Please consult the detail section of the knowledge article for additional information.
   REC-ACTION: Schedule a repair action to replace the affected Field Replaceable Unit (FRU),
   the identity of which can be determined using fmdump -v -u EVENT_ID.
   Please consult the detail section of the knowledge article for additional information.



Step 2. Collect the output from the 'fmdump  -v  -u  <Event-ID>' command
 


   SPARC Enterprise platform example:

   xscf> fmdump -v -u 69f0e34e-ecfd-4778-9f68-666e49b4015f

         TIME                 UUID                                 MSG-ID
         Mar 27 15:26:48.9043 69f0e34e-ecfd-4778-9f68-666e49b4015f SCF-8004-HY
           100%  fault.chassis.device.misconfig

                 Problem in: hc:///chassis=0/xbu=0/ssm=0
                    Affects: hc:///chassis=0/xbu=0
                        FRU: hc://:product-id=SPARC-Enterprise:chassis-id=nwk-dc2-1:
                             server-id=nwk-dc2-1-sc0:serial=PP0639L444:
                             part=CA06620-D301 A6:revision=0201/component=/XBU_B#0




Step 3. Contact your Authorized Service Provider.



If you require additional information, please refer to InfoDoc #87402.
event_registry_properties.name: impact
event_registry_properties.item: The misconfigured FRU or device will not be powered up. The platform may not powerup. Please consult the detail section of the knowledge article for additional information.
event_registry_properties.name: response
event_registry_properties.item: The misconfigured FRU or device will not be powered up. Please consult the detail section of the knowledge article for additional information.
event_registry_properties.name: title
event_registry_properties.item: Misconfigured FRU or device detected during powerup.
